com.barrysheehan.www

Class QuickSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.barrysheehan.www.QuickSort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sorter

    public class QuickSort
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sorter
    Sorts an int[] array using an implementation of Quick Sort, an unstable efficient comparison-based sorting algorithm.

    Quick Sort sorts an array by selecting a "pivot point" within the array. All values smaller than the value at this pivot point are moved to its left, and all values larger are moved to its right, creating two subarrays of integers.

    This process is repeated recursively until there are no more values to be rearranged. Finally the array is rebuilt in sorted order.

    This implementation of the Quick Sort algorithm can be found on Baeldung.com at the url below. I added the sort() method to allow sorting by passing only one parameter, the int[] array to be sorted https://www.baeldung.com/java-quicksort

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Specified by:

      • sort

        public void sort(int[] arr)
        Calls the quickSort() method passing the input array to be sorted, the first index of the array and the last index of the array.

        This method was added to allow quickSort() to be called passing only one argument, the array to be sorted. The pivot point selected is the final index in the input array.

        Specified by:
        sort in interface Sorter
        Parameters:
        arr - the integer array to be sorted

      • quickSort

        public void quickSort(int[] arr,
                      int begin,
                      int end)
        Sorts the values in an int[] array by comparing elements in the array.

        Creates a pivot point (partitioning index) by calling the partition() method on the input array and recursively calls itself on the subarrays to the left and the right of this partition index.

        Parameters:
        arr - the integer array to be sorted
        begin - the index of the first element in this partition of the array
        end - the index of the last element in this partition of the aray
